meanings.definition: A flat, round dish used for serving food.
meanings.sent1: Mom placed the delicious pie on the plate.
meanings.sent2: The waiter carried a stack of plates to the table.
meanings.sent3: The plate spun around on the table, entertaining the guests.
meanings.sent4: The plate of cookies disappeared in seconds at the party.
meanings.sent5: The shiny plate reflected the warm candlelight beautifully.

meanings.definition: A thin, flat piece of metal used for various purposes.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used a metal plate to fix the car.
meanings.sent2: The artist hammered the metal plate to create a design.
meanings.sent3: The plate acted as a shield against the strong wind.
meanings.sent4: The plate of armor gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The plate of steel was strong enough to hold the weight.

meanings.definition: A flat, thin piece of glass used in windows or mirrors.
meanings.sent1: The window shattered, leaving a broken plate of glass.
meanings.sent2: The mirror reflected her image clearly on the glass plate.
meanings.sent3: The plate of glass made a loud sound when it broke.
meanings.sent4: The plate of glass seemed to disappear when the lights went out.
meanings.sent5: The plate of glass was so clear, it almost looked like water.

meanings.definition: A flat, rigid structure used in surgery to support or repair a broken bone.
meanings.sent1: The doctor carefully inserted the metal plate to fix the bone.
meanings.sent2: The plate held the bone in place during the surgery.
meanings.sent3: The plate in his leg made him feel like a robot.
meanings.sent4: The plate of metal became a permanent part of his body.
meanings.sent5: The plate saved his leg from being amputated.
